alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 4:16PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN DINWIDDIE AND NORTHEASTERN BRUNSWICK COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McKenney, moving east at 15 mph. This storm has been exhibiting weak, broad rotation. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... McKenney around 420 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Center Star, Burgess, Cherry Hill, Rawlings, Rocky Run, Warfield, Wharfs Store, and Butterworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
